availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Randolph Desha (Fayette County, Kentucky, physician.)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, physician. Mason County, Kentucky, native. Son of Joseph Holmes Desha and Margaret Bledsoe Desha. Married to Mary Bracken Curry Desha. Father of Ben Desha, Issa Desha Breckinridge, Adelaide Desha, Mary Desha, and Ella Desha. Physician in Fayette County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1850. Physician in Fayette County in 1860. Owned thirteen enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 1, p. 189A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 1, p. 577.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, p. 518.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, p. 464A.
Jay Guy Cisco, Historic Sumner County, Tennessee: With Genealogies of the Bledsoe, Gage, and Douglass Families, and Genealogical Notes of Other Sumner County Families (Nashville: Folk-Keelin Printing Company, 1909), 173, 178.
"John Randolph Desha (1804-1878)," Find A Grave, Memorial #15751437, accessed April 27, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/15751437/john-randolph-desha.
